availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Larkin J. Procter (Edmonson County, Kentucky, attorney, politician, hotelkeeper, and Mammoth Cave lessee)

body.p: Edmonson County, Kentucky, attorney, politician, hotelkeeper, and Mammoth Cave lessee. Bracken County, Kentucky, native. Married to Mary Eleanor Roberts Procter on October 24, 1844. Father of Walker R. Procter, David L. Procter, and James Procter. Resident in Mason County, Kentucky, in 1836. Studied law and admitted to the bar in 1841. Member of the Whig Party. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Lewis County from 1843 to 1844. Delegate to the Kentucky Constitutional Convention from Lewis County in 1849. Attorney in Edmonson County in 1850. Resident of Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, from 1853 to 1856. Lessee of Mammoth Cave in Edmonson County, Kentucky, from 1856 to 1861. Hotelkeeper in Edmonson County in 1860. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Edmonson County 1861 to 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lewis County, District 2, p. 203.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Edmonson County, p. 85.
Evening Bulletin (Maysville, Ky.), November 22, 1895.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994045 Lewis County Marriages.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Lewis County Marriages, Film 000344051, p. 86.
"Larkin J. Procter (1822-1895)," Find A Grave, Memorial 42902849, accessed August 10, 2017, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/42902849.
